statements: UPDATE CustomerAccounts SET balance = 1200 WHERE account_number = 12345;
UPDATE CustomerAccounts SET transaction_history = '{"type": "deposit", "amount": 500}' WHERE account_number = 54321;
UPDATE CustomerAccounts SET balance = balance + 1000, transaction_history = '{"transaction": "Deposit", "amount": 1000}' WHERE account_number = 12345;
UPDATE CustomerAccounts SET transaction_history = CONCAT(transaction_history, '{"transaction": "Withdrawal", "amount": 500}'), balance = balance - 500 WHERE account_number = 54321;
UPDATE CustomerAccounts SET balance = 5000.75 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Transactions SET amount = 100.25, transaction_date = '2022-08-15' WHERE transaction_id = 10;
UPDATE CustomerAccounts SET balance = balance + 1000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Transactions SET amount = amount - 500.50, transaction_date = now() WHERE account_number = 12345;
UPDATE customer_accounts SET balance = 5000.00 WHERE account_number = 12345;
UPDATE account_holders SET email = 'john.doe@example.com', phone_number = '+123456789' WHERE account_number = 54321;
UPDATE transactions SET amount = amount + 100.50 WHERE transaction_type = 'deposit'
UPDATE customer_accounts SET balance = balance - 5000.00 WHERE account_number = 12345
UPDATE customers SET balance = 1500.50 WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = 5000.00, account_number = 1234567890 WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE customers SET customer_name = 'John Doe', balance = 5000.00 WHERE customer_id = 101;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - 1000.00 WHERE customer_id = 101 AND account_id = 201;
UPDATE customers SET balance = 1500.00 WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = 5000.75, account_number = 'ABC12345' WHERE account_id = 101;
UPDATE customers SET first_name = 'Alice', last_name = 'Jones' WHERE customer_id = 1001;
UPDATE cards SET expiration_date = '2023-12-31', cvv = 456 WHERE customer_id = 2002;
